feed.title: Services from Ministry of Housing, Communities & Local Government (MHCLG)

entry.title: Prove your right to rent in England
entry.summary: Prove and share details of your right to rent in England if you have a biometric residence card or permit, settled or pre-settled status, or you applied for a visa and used the ‘UK Immigration: ID Check’ app to scan your ide…

entry.title: View a tenant's right to rent in England
entry.summary: View a tenant's right to rent if they have a biometric residence card, biometric residence permit, settled or pre-settled status, or applied for a visa and used the ‘UK Immigration: ID Check’ app to scan their identity …

entry.summary: Expressions of interest for a project which aims to improve people’s mental health through green social prescribing.

entry.summary: You need to check if a tenant is allowed to rent private residential property in England

entry.summary: You need to register with your local council if you want to exhibit, use or train performing animals in Wales or Scotland.

entry.summary: Apply for a riding establishment licence if you want to run a business where horses or ponies are hired out for riding or used for riding instruction in Wales or Scotland

entry.summary: Community sponsorship is a way that community groups can be involved in supporting the resettlement of vulnerable people fleeing conflict.

entry.summary: Guidance notes for completing the quarterly revenue outturn (QRO).

entry.title: Your rights to housing if you're under 18
entry.summary: If you're under 18, you cannot usually rent your own home, but you'll be on the priority list for council housing - your rights and what happens if you want to leave home

entry.summary: Most tenants have the right to renew a lease - exceptions and landlord's rights to refuse a renewal of a lease

entry.summary: Report your lost, stolen or damaged Blue Badge and get a replacement.

entry.summary: School closures happen because of an emergency like severe weather - check whether your child's school is closed on your local council website

entry.summary: Template and guidance notes for the general fund revenue account budget (RA).

entry.summary: You need a licence for handling meat, fish, egg or dairy products unless you sell these direct to the public

entry.summary: As a landlord, find out if the leaseholders in your block have the right to take over management of your building, and the process they must go through to do this

entry.summary: As a business, you'll have to pay for any water you use, and for the drainage of water and any effluent (liquid waste) you produce

entry.summary: Report a street light problem to the local council - they are responsible for installation and maintenance of street lighting

entry.summary: You must register with the police if you manufacture, sell or transfer shotguns, firearms or ammunition or are involved in the repairing, testing or proving of them

entry.summary: Find sheltered or supported housing from your council with facilities such as alarms or wardens: for elderly, disabled or vulnerable people

entry.summary: You need to be registered on the Gas Safe Register to work on gas fittings or gas storage vessels in the UK

entry.summary: How to offer help to refugees in your area: helping them settle in, running activities or offering career advice

entry.summary: Find out about changes to care and support from your local council.

entry.summary: This prospectus outlines a further opportunity for coastal areas in England to apply to establish a Coastal Community Team.

entry.title: Apply for school transport for a child with special educational needs and disabilities
entry.summary: If your child cannot walk to school because of their special educational needs and disabilities (SEND) your local council must provide transport

entry.summary: Disabled Facilities Grants help towards the costs of making changes to your home so you can continue to live there

entry.summary: Application form and guidance note for local authorities required to undertake a Community Governance Review in 2016 to 2017.

entry.summary: Blue Badge parking permits let disabled drivers and passengers park nearer to where they're going - find out more about Blue Badges from your council

entry.summary: What happens to benefits if you or someone in your family goes to prison or on remand

entry.title: Scheduled monument consent (England, Scotland and Wales)
entry.summary: You need a licence to carry out work that would demolish, damage, remove, repair, alter or add to a scheduled monument, or to carry out any flooding or tipping operations on land in, on, or under a monument

entry.summary: Contact your police and crime commissioner (PCC) to make a suggestion or a complaint on how your local area is policed - become a PCC election candidate, complain about your PCC

entry.summary: Check if you're eligible for a Blue Badge and apply or renew

entry.summary: Sell door to door or in the street without a stall, eligibility, how to apply, penalties

entry.summary: Get information from your local council about the right to buy your council house or flat, including where to send the application form

entry.summary: If you think a child or young person is at risk or being abused or neglected, contact the children’s social care team at their local council.

entry.summary: Questionnaire and physical survey form used for the English housing survey.

entry.summary: Sets out how to access flood relief match funding available to match donations by the public in response to damage caused by Storm Desmond.

entry.summary: Check with your local council before doing building work on your home if you live in a conservation area

entry.summary: You cannot buy or use fireworks if you're under 18, and you must not set off fireworks between 11pm and 7am, except on certain occasions

entry.summary: Get help and advice from your local council if you're homeless or about to lose your home.

entry.summary: To sell fireworks (wholesale or retail up to 2 tonnes net explosive content) you must be registered or licensed with the local authority Trading Standards office

entry.summary: Find out how to get a recycling bin from your local council

entry.summary: The library catalogue allows you to search all the titles in a public library - many councils offer online access to their library catalogue

entry.summary: You can reserve books and other items such as DVDs at your local library - contact your council for more information

entry.summary: Your local council is responsible for sweeping streets and removing litter - report any problems to your local council

entry.summary: Report your missing or lost dog to the council's dog warden service

entry.summary: Find out if your council collects recycling, how to recycle household waste such as mobile phones, computers, packaging and green waste

entry.summary: Your local council may help you get rid of common pests in your property like mice, wasps and bedbugs with pest control services

entry.summary: Managing asbestos for your premises, your responsibilities, asbestos regulations, keeping records, health and safety, finding accredited surveyors, penalties

entry.summary: Landlords need to follow certain procedures when evicting tenants - find out about eviction notices, harassment and illegal evictions, and going to court

entry.summary: Report an unlicensed private hire vehicle (PHV) or taxi driver to the local council or Transport for London (TfL)

entry.summary: A tenancy agreement is a contract between you and a landlord - ending a tenancy, changing a tenancy, tenancy types and assured shorthold tenancies

entry.summary: Estimate your business rates by multiplying the rateable value of your business by a multiplier value set by the government

entry.summary: Questionnaire and physical survey form used for the English housing survey.

entry.summary: Report a dead or injured animal such as a badger, fox or domestic pet found on the road

entry.summary: Find the discounts and concessions that are available in your area for travel to school sixth form or college through your local council website

entry.summary: Apply to adopt a child through your local council if you are 21 or over and can offer a stable home to a child

entry.summary: Find out how you can control pests on your property - help from professionals, methods you can and cannot use, protecting wildlife, getting a wildlife licence

entry.summary: You need a licence to sell alcohol from a licensed premises

entry.summary: Find nature reserves, national parks and Areas of Outstanding Natural Beauty and green spaces

entry.summary: Report potholes on A roads, motorways and local roads to the council

entry.summary: Check your council's website to find out when your rubbish will be collected

entry.summary: You may be eligible for discounts on your business rates - business rates relief, how to apply

entry.summary: As a tenant renting out a commercial property, you have certain responsibilities including maintenance, health and safety, and making provisions for your staff and visitors

entry.summary: You may need a licence to breed dogs from your local council

entry.summary: Help to Buy and affordable home ownership schemes to help first-time buyers and home movers - equity loan, mortgage guarantee and ISA, shared ownership

entry.summary: You need to register with the relevant local council to get a tattoo, piercing and electrolysis licence in England and Wales

entry.summary: Some older people can get free travel on local buses - contact your council to check your eligibility and apply for a bus pass

entry.summary: Landlord responsibilities when renting out your property, including making repairs, health and safety, increasing the rent and changing regulated tenancies.

entry.summary: Your Council Tax bill - how to work it out, who has to pay, discounts and exemptions for students and disabled people, second homes, empty properties, paying the bill

entry.summary: You'll need a premises licence if you want to sell alcohol or offer entertainment from a particular venue

entry.summary: Check which electric (plug-in) and hybrid cars, vans and motorbikes are available for a grant.

entry.title: Apply for a licence to keep a wild animal
entry.summary: You need a licence to keep certain kinds of wild or dangerous animals: contact your council for more information

entry.title: Clear snow from a road, path or cycleway
entry.summary: What you can do to clear snow and ice from pavements and roads, using salt and sand

entry.title: Ending a commercial property lease early
entry.summary: How to end a commercial lease early, what happens if you break the terms of your lease, use a clause in your agreement

entry.title: Licence for projections over a highway (England & Wales)
entry.summary: You need a licence to build a bridge or alter a bridge above a public highway

entry.title: Registration of independent health care service (England and Wales)
entry.summary: You need to register with the Care Quality Commission or Healthcare Inspectorate to run an independent health care service (eg private hospital or clinic) in England and Wales

entry.title: Operator of approved slaughter house RPA notification (England)
entry.summary: If you become an operator of an approved slaughterhouse you must notify the Rural Payments Agency (RPA) in writing within 28 days of starting the business

entry.title: Child work permit (England and Wales)
entry.summary: To employ a child in the UK, you may need to get a work permit from your local authority

entry.title: Safety certificates: sports stands (England, Scotland and Wales)
entry.summary: How to apply for a safety certificate for a sports stand - general safety certificate, special safety certificate, responsibilities, fines and penalties

entry.title: Market stall licence
entry.summary: To run a market stall as a trader, you need either a temporary ('casual') or permanent licence from the local council.

entry.title: Busking licence (England and Wales)
entry.summary: You may need a busking licence or permit from the council before busking in that area. Find out the council's rules on busking and apply online.

entry.title: Massage and special treatment premises licensing
entry.summary: Contact your council if you run an establishment for massage or other special treatments and need a premises licence

entry.title: Skip operator licence
entry.summary: Get a skip permit for your skip hire company - skip hire licence, local authority, highway act

entry.title: Petroleum Storage Licence (England, Scotland and Wales)
entry.summary: You need a petroleum licence to store and supply petrol to internal combustion vehicles - where to apply for your licence

entry.title: Weighbridge operator certificate
entry.summary: Contact your council for a certificate of competence to operate a chargeable weighbridge

entry.title: Hackney carriage vehicle licence (England, Scotland and Wales)
entry.summary: You need a licence to run or own a hackney carriage

entry.title: Sports ground safety certificate (England, Scotland and Wales)
entry.summary: Getting a safety certificate to operate a sports ground in England, Scotland or Wales - terms and conditions, fees and restrictions

entry.title: Mixing ammonium nitrate (with fuel oil) licence
entry.summary: You need a manufacturing licence to combine ammonium nitrate and fuel oil to create mixtures for use in certain blasting operations

entry.title: Permission to place tables and chairs on the pavement
entry.summary: Get a licence to place furniture on the pavement in England and Wales - how to apply, restrictions, fines, penalties

entry.title: Right to Buy: application form (RTB1)
entry.summary: The RTB1 form is the notice claiming the Right to Buy that tenants need to complete.

entry.title: Road occupation licence for building work (England and Wales)
entry.summary: You must get a licence from the council to dig up the road, or temporarily occupy it in connection with building work - fines, penalties

entry.title: English housing survey 2012 to 2013: questionnaire and physical survey form
entry.summary: Questionnaire and physical survey form used for the English housing survey.

entry.title: Park homes: notification of deposit
entry.summary: Form to be used to notify park home owners when the agreed site rules have been deposited with the local authority.

entry.title: Park homes: notification of deposit of deletion notice
entry.summary: Form to be used to notify park home owners that an agreed deletion of, or to, the site rules have been deposited with the local authority.

entry.title: Park homes: consultation response
entry.summary: Form to be used when notifying park (mobile) home owners of the outcome of a consultation on changes to park home site rules.

entry.title: Park homes: proposal notice
entry.summary: Form to be used when consulting park (mobile) home owners on the proposed rules or changes to the site rules.

entry.title: Cooling tower notification
entry.summary: Cooling tower notification for commercial site owners

entry.title: Commercial Inland Fishing Licence
entry.summary: You need a licence to net for salmon and sea trout or fish for eels using nets, trawls or traps

entry.title: Delivering Differently: expression of interest
entry.summary: An application form for the Delivering Differently fund, which helps local authorities transform services through alternative delivery models.

entry.title: Challenge the government to sell land or property (Right to Contest)
entry.summary: If you believe land or property is not needed and could be put to better economic use, then you can challenge the government by submitting a Right to Contest application.

entry.title: English housing survey 2011 to 2012: questionnaire and physical survey form
entry.summary: Questionnaire and physical survey form used for the English housing survey.

entry.title: Horse-drawn hackney carriage licence (England and Wales)
entry.summary: You'll need a hackney vehicle licence if you want to use a horse and carriage for paying customers

entry.title: Private hire vehicle operator licence outside London
entry.summary: Private hire vehicle operator licence outside London; taxi, private hire, mincab, licence, vehicle

entry.title: Pitch fee review form: park homes
entry.summary: This form should be used if the site owner is proposing to change the pitch fee.

entry.title: Buyer's information form: park homes
entry.summary: Form to fill in and give to the buyer when selling your park home.

entry.title: Notice of proposed sale form: park homes
entry.summary: Form to fill in and give to the site owner.

entry.title: Assignment form: park homes
entry.summary: Form to fill in when assigning the pitch agreement to the new owner.

entry.title: Notice of assignment form: park homes
entry.summary: Form for the buyer to fill in so they can pay commission to the site owner.

entry.title: Notice of proposed gift form: park homes
entry.summary: Form to fill in when gifting (giving away) your park home to a family member.

entry.title: Licences to use music online or on mobile technology
entry.summary: You may need a licence to use copyright music online or on mobiles

entry.title: Right to Buy: initial notice of delay form (RTB6)
entry.summary: The RTB6 form is for a tenant to use if their landlord is not completing parts of the Right to Buy application within set time limits.

entry.title: Right to Buy: operative notice of delay form (RTB8)
entry.summary: The RTB8 form is for a tenant to use if they do not get a response to the initial notice of delay form.

entry.title: Pavement or street display licence (England and Wales)
entry.summary: Get a licence to put an advertising sign on the road or pavement in England and Wales - restrictions, fines, penalties

entry.title: Hairdresser registration (England)
entry.summary: You may have to register with your local council in England if you run a hairdressing or barbers business, so that they can check you're following health and safety rules

entry.title: Apply for Council Tax Reduction
entry.summary: Apply to your local council for Council Tax Reduction if you're on a low income or benefits - this has replaced Council Tax Benefit

entry.title: Firefighters' pension scheme: medical appeals forms
entry.summary: Forms relating to medical appeals for the firefighters' pension scheme.

entry.title: Skip licence (England and Wales)
entry.summary: You or the skip hire company need a skip licence/permit if you want to put a skip on a public road. You may need safety lights, traffic cones or markings

entry.title: Street works licence (England, Scotland and Wales)
entry.summary: You need a licence to place apparatus on a street or road in England, Wales and Scotland

entry.title: Hackney carriage licence (England, Scotland and Wales)
entry.summary: You need a licence to drive a hackney carriage - taxicabs, England, excluding London, Scotland and Wales

entry.title: Scaffolding and hoarding licence (England and Wales)
entry.summary: You need a licence from the local authority to put up scaffolding or hoarding on a public highway in the UK.

entry.title: Competent person schemes
entry.summary: Join a competent person scheme to self-certify certain types of building work instead of getting building regulations approval from a council or private inspector - how to join, current schemes

entry.title: Right to Buy: notice in reply to a tenant's claim (RTB2)
entry.summary: The RTB2 form is the notice that a council sends to a tenant who has applied to buy their home through the Right to Buy scheme.

entry.title: Approval of premises for civil marriage and civil partnership (England and Wales)
entry.summary: How to get a licence (grant of approval) to hold a civil marriage or civil partnership in your venue, and what requirements or conditions to follow

entry.title: Hypnotism permit (England, Scotland and Wales)
entry.summary: You must hold a permit to stage a public performance of hypnotism for entertainment purposes in England, Wales and Scotland - learn how to apply, conditions, fines and penalties

entry.title: Premises licence (Scotland)
entry.summary: You'll need a premises licence if you want to sell alcohol or offer entertainment from a particular venue

entry.title: Street collection licence (England & Wales)
entry.summary: If you want to collect money or sell items on the street for charity, you might need a street collection licence, depending on your local council

entry.title: Auction premises registration
entry.summary: To sell goods by auction in a stall or other premises you might need to register with your local council

entry.title: Comment on an alcohol licence
entry.summary: How to comment on an alcohol licence or ask for an existing licence to be reviewed - what you need to do, who to apply to and what happens at licensing hearings

entry.title: House fires: financial help and fire safety
entry.summary: Your council can help you after a fire in your home - Council, emergency housing, Red Cross, fire safety

entry.title: Contact your council about business rates bill
entry.summary: Find out about your business rates bill, business rate relief or pay your bill through your local council

entry.title: Find a local support group for children, young people and families
entry.summary: Your local council may have details of organisations in your community that can give families and young people help and support

entry.title: Sex shop and cinema licence (England and Wales)
entry.summary: Contact your council for a sex establishment licence if you want to run a sex shop or adult cinema

entry.title: Report a blocked drain
entry.summary: Your local council is responsible for public drains - report a blockage.

entry.title: Report road flooding
entry.summary: If you find a flooded road or street, report it to your local council

entry.title: Home education: get information from your council
entry.summary: Your responsibilities with your local council if you want to educate your child at home - sometimes called home schooling

entry.title: Find safe walking or cycling routes to your child's school
entry.summary: Plan a journey so your child can get safely to and from school

entry.title: Local services disrupted by severe weather
entry.summary: Information about local services that have been disrupted by severe weather conditions

entry.title: Apply for a Disabled Facilities Grant
entry.summary: Apply for financial help to make your home suitable for a disabled person

entry.title: Apply for Youth Opportunity Funding
entry.summary: The Youth Opportunities Fund provides money for young people to use on activities and projects - apply to your local council

entry.title: Report fly-posting
entry.summary: Report fly-posting to your local council - posters, stickers or bills put up without permission of the property owner

entry.title: Book internet access in your library
entry.summary: Many libraries offer free internet access - book internet access at your local council library

entry.title: Report vandalism
entry.summary: Report vandalised property to your local council

entry.title: Apply for equipment for your home if you're disabled
entry.summary: Apply to your local council for equipment or help adapting your home if you’re disabled

entry.title: Apply to hold a street party
entry.summary: Check what you need to tell your local council if you are organising a small street party with your neighbours

entry.title: Find out which roads your council will grit
entry.summary: Plan your journey in cold weather - find out about gritting of roads and footpaths, the location of grit bins and snow clearance

entry.title: Find local transport plans
entry.summary: Check the transport plan for maintenance, improvements and changes in your local area with the council

entry.title: Report a problem with 'street furniture'
entry.summary: Report a problem with street furniture, which includes things like bollards, litter bins, benches and cycle racks to the council

entry.title: Report a noise nuisance to your council
entry.summary: Report a noise problem like loud music, noisy pubs, neighbour's parties or barking dogs to your local council

entry.title: Find your local park
entry.summary: Information about parks and open spaces near you, including playgrounds, nature reserves, wildlife sites and sports pitches

entry.title: Claim compensation for injuries caused by roads or pavements
entry.summary: You may be able to claim compensation from the council if you've had an accident caused by a road or pavement

entry.title: Report a dog fouling problem
entry.summary: The local council must keep public areas like parks, playgrounds and pavements clear of dog mess - report a dog fouling problem to the local council

entry.title: Apply to work on a tree that's protected
entry.summary: You may need to make a 'works to trees' application if they’re protected by a ‘tree preservation order’ (TPO) or you live in a conservation area.

entry.title: Dispose of garden waste
entry.summary: Arrange for the collection of garden waste by your council

entry.title: Report discarded syringes
entry.summary: Report discarded syringes, needles and other drug related items in public places to your council

entry.title: Apply for a community alarm
entry.summary: Many councils provide community alarm services to support independent living in your own home

entry.title: Find a mobile library
entry.summary: Check whether a mobile library service visits your area

entry.title: Contact your council about crime prevention and community safety
entry.summary: Check out schemes for crime prevention and community safety with your council

entry.title: Search local archives
entry.summary: Explore the local archives to help your research into family and local history at your local council

entry.title: Rent a council garage
entry.summary: Apply to rent a garage from the local council - there may be a waiting list

entry.title: Preparing for emergencies: find out about local plans
entry.summary: Check out your local council's emergency plan covering major incidents like flooding, flu pandemics and transport accidents

entry.title: Request a repair to a council property
entry.summary: Request a repair to a council property to your local council - urgent problems, Right to Repair, health, safety, security

entry.title: Report squatters in a council property
entry.summary: Report squatters in a council property to the local council

entry.title: Apply for a Council Tax discount
entry.summary: Check with your council if you're eligible for a discount on your Council Tax

entry.title: Find local consultations
entry.summary: Councils carry out consultations to help plan, manage and deliver services. Have your say about local issues by responding to consultations run by your council

entry.title: Swap your council or housing association home
entry.summary: Exchanging your council or housing association property if you want to move house - tenants, rules, permission from landlords, mutual exchange

entry.title: Find out about community transport services and Shopmobility
entry.summary: Many areas have community transport services for people who have difficulty using public transport

entry.title: Apply for funding for community projects
entry.summary: Contact your council about funding and grants for your project - activities for young people, volunteer programmes, development of communal facilities

entry.title: Complain about your council
entry.summary: Complain to your council if they have done something wrong, failed to provide a service or not followed correct procedures

entry.title: Make an insurance claim against your council
entry.summary: If you're a council tenant you may be able to make an insurance claim against the council for any damage they are responsible for

entry.title: Request a speed limit change
entry.summary: Local speed limits are set by the council

entry.title: Report a problem with a pavement
entry.summary: Report damaged pavements to the local council - broken or missing slabs, removing weeds

entry.title: Report an abandoned vehicle
entry.summary: You can report an abandoned vehicle like a dumped car to the local council

entry.title: Report a problem with a traffic light
entry.summary: How to report faulty or broken traffic lights depends on where you live and the type of road

entry.title: Apply for an allotment
entry.summary: Rent an allotment through your council to grow your own fruit and vegetables - you can be allocated a plot or added to a waiting list

entry.title: Pay your Council Tax
entry.summary: Pay Council Tax online or by other methods, like direct debit to your local council

entry.title: Report graffiti
entry.summary: Your local council is usually responsible for removing graffiti from things like public buildings, monuments, benches and bins

entry.title: Request a pedestrian crossing
entry.summary: Request a pedestrian crossing like a puffin crossing, toucan crossing or zebra crossing from the local council

entry.title: Get a parking permit
entry.summary: Your council has information on parking permit schemes in your area

entry.title: Garden maintenance for elderly or disabled council tenants
entry.summary: Contact your council to find out whether they offer a garden maintenance service for elderly or disabled council tenants

entry.title: Get meals at home (meals on wheels)
entry.summary: Apply for meals at home from your council or other local organisation

entry.title: Report a problem with a street name sign
entry.summary: Report a missing or damaged street or road name sign to your local council

entry.title: Join a library
entry.summary: Your local library offers many services like book loans, CD rental and internet access - contact your council for more information

entry.title: Renew a library item
entry.summary: Renew your library items like books and DVDs online through your local council website

entry.title: Local library services
entry.summary: Find your nearest library to access services such as book loans, CD rentals and internet access

entry.title: Complain about problems caused by demolition works
entry.summary: If demolition work is causing problems - like noise or obstruction to pavements or roads - you can complain to your council

entry.title: Apply for special collection of large waste items
entry.summary: Arrange a special collection for large waste items - most councils will collect things like old sofas, fridges or washing machines for a fee

entry.title: Apply for a dropped kerb
entry.summary: A dropped kerb allows vehicles to cross the pavement from the road to a driveway - contact your local council to find out how to apply for a dropped kerb

entry.title: Disability day care centres
entry.summary: Contact your local council to find out what support and help is available at day care centres for disabled people

entry.title: Housing association homes
entry.summary: How to apply for a housing association home, types of tenancy agreement and the Right to Acquire

entry.title: Find a community support group or organisation
entry.summary: Your local council may have details of organisations in your community that can give help and support - contact your council to find out more

entry.title: Report a derelict or abandoned building
entry.summary: You can report a derelict or abandoned building to the building control section of the local council

entry.title: Report a dangerous building or structure
entry.summary: You can report a dangerous building to the local council

entry.title: Scaffolding rules
entry.summary: The rules for putting up scaffolding on your property - licence, checks, safety, builder, scaffold companies

entry.title: Public Request to Order Disposal
entry.summary: This form helps people to exercise their rights under the Community Right to Reclaim Land to bring disused property back into beneficial use.

entry.title: Right to Acquire: application form (RTA1)
entry.summary: This form is for housing association tenants who wish to apply to buy their home through the Right to Acquire scheme.

entry.title: English housing survey 2008 to 2009: market value survey questionnaire
entry.summary: Questionnaire for the 2008 to 2009 market value component of the English housing survey.

entry.title: Planning application forms: templates for local planning authorities
entry.summary: This collection brings together planning application form templates for local planning authorities to use when producing their own versions.
